text: So what are you grumpy about today Mr Poody?
Oh I see.
You don’t like all that tasty food?
That’s a shame.

You have some delicious, fresh vegetables
there on your plate.

Perfect peas, beautiful broccoli, radiant
runner beans.

OK well let’s have a look at what other
food you have got in your fridge.
Oh Mr Poody.

This may look really yummy but too much of
this food isn’t very good for you at all.

It’s very important for your body and your
brain that you eat healthy food every day.
You see those carrots over there.

Didn’t your mummy and daddy ever tell you
that they make you see in the dark?
And those cabbages and that spinach.

Did you know that they make your heart and
muscles grow big and strong?
Let’s go for a walk.
It’s a lovely sunny day isn’t it?
Oh do be careful otherwise….
You might get hurt.

Let’s find something else really fun to
do.
Look Mr Poody.
A little fishing boat.
Oh how fun.
Fresh fish.
How scrummy.

That would definitely sort your noisy tummy
out.

Fish is a very healthy food and especially
good for your brain.
Eating it makes you very clever.
Are you having fun Mr Poody?
Ah no luck I see.
Well be patient.
Good things come to those who wait.
Oh well done.
I told you that you would catch something.
You must be so happy.
Shall we go back home and cook it now?

I don’t like the look of these deep, dark
waters.
Let’s be safe and go back to shore.
It must be a big one Mr Poody.
Come on, try and reel it in!
Poor you Mr Poody.
I think it’s time to go home don’t you?

Everything on that table is packed with yummy
goodness and very healthy.
Good job Mr Poody.
Waaaaaiiiit.
I hope you have washed your hands.

If you don't, you can pick up germs from anything
that you touch and make yourself really sick
or...

pass your germs to your friends and family
and make them really ill too
